ASE2025repos/ase-boose-assignment-Rah140.title: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio | BOOSE Documentation
ASE2025repos/ase-boose-assignment-Rah140.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Fill in the fields below. Muhammed Raheem Ali Your Group Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. At least 5 documented commits. Readme.md file filled in correctly. 2 Unit Tests for basic drawing commands above (1) Unit Test for moveto command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for drawTo command (variables storing pen position are correct) Unit Test for a multiline program. 3 XML Comments/documentation produced (1) Fully documented with XML comments and Documentation web site produced 4 Exception Handling (1) 5 Library (DLL) installed and working with reasonable user interface (2) Form interface with program window, output window and run button BOOSE DLL library installed call about method and display returned information in output/debug window you can use System.Diagnostics to output to the debug window 6 Basic drawing commands of the library are implemented (2) Moveto, circle, rect, pencolour, write. Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose) You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". I've tried to make it so you can't but who knows, either way, you've been told. You MUST fill in this form whilst recording your YouTube Video AND submit it to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Links These are for convinience. Check on myBeckett in the Assessment directory for any up to date links. BOOSE Documentation BOOSE DLL Download Assignment Specification - including all university details Detailed Assignment Information - with marking scheme Assignment Help Videos Remember that BOOSE.DLL maybe updated, as it may have bugs in it, or new features may be added. Keep updated on Discord and make sure you always have the latest version in your project. V1.0

README.html.title: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio | BOOSE Documentation
README.html.summary: ASE semester 1 2025 Portfolio Basic Object Orientated Software Engineering (BOOSE). Fill in the fields below. Muhammed Raheem Ali Group 4 Each element is covered in the weekly sessions, using the BOOSE library source code as an example. I will discuss how I implemented the more difficult elements (like the parser, implementing loops etc.) Keep your progress up to date below. Put "DONE" after each section, when you have done it. The number in brackets represents the component that each element contributes to. Checkpoint 1 Version Control (1) At least two documented commits to provided on GitHub Classroom BEFORE 12pm 7th October. DONE At least 5 documented commits. DONE Readme.md file filled in correctly. DONE 2 Unit Tests for basic drawing commands above (1) Unit Test for moveto command (variables storing pen position are correct) DONE Unit Test for drawTo command (variables storing pen position are correct) DONE Unit Test for a multiline program. DONE 3 XML Comments/documentation produced (1) Fully documented with XML comments and Documentation web site produced DONE 4 Exception Handling (1) DONE 5 Library (DLL) installed and working with reasonable user interface (2) Form interface with program window, output window and run button DONE BOOSE DLL library installed DONE call about method and display returned information in output/debug window DONE you can use System.Diagnostics to output to the debug window DONE 6 Basic drawing commands of the library are implemented (2) Moveto, circle, rect, pencolour, write. DONE Unrestricted drawing programs can be run (1unrestrictedDrawing.boose) DONE You MUST fill in the this form before submission and submit your zipped up project to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Final Submission 1 Further Version Control (1) DONE You must continue to use VC to a professional standard with frequent and clear commits Your Readme.md must be up to date 2 Use of Interfaces (1) DONE Interfaces to be used for all classes where appropriate 3 Further Unit Testing (1) DONE Tests for full program all of the facilities completed in 5,6 and 7 below It is up to you how design your tests (i.e. one test per facility or one test testing many but they must be clearly documented with XML comments) 4 Design Patterns (1) DONE Use of factory Design Pattern for command creation Use of Singleton Design Pattern Demonstrate the use of another design pattern of your choice (for 5,6 and 7 you can click the links to see the example BOOSE programs that must be run, these are in your Portfolio. You must run the unrestricted programs and replace the image already there with an image of your BOOSE Interpreter running the BOOSE programs. You may show further programs in your portfolio.) 5 Replaced variables (2) * DONE Int Real Array 6 Replaced if, while, for (2) * DONE While For If else 7 Replaced Methods (2) * DONE 8 Additional (web version, text-based version, extension to BOOSE itself, etc, discuss with your tutor) (2) * You must rewrite the functionality and not try and "hack the system". I've tried to make it so you can't but who knows, either way, you've been told. You MUST fill in this form whilst recording your YouTube Video AND submit it to myBeckett Read the hand in instructions on myBeckett carefully to ensure you are submitting everything correctly, as if you don't you may be subject to a penalty. Links These are for convinience. Check on myBeckett in the Assessment directory for any up to date links. api/BOOSEcode2.MyArray.html.title: Class MyArray | BOOSE Documentation
api/BOOSEcode2.MyArray.html.summary: Class MyArray Namespace BOOSEcode2 Assembly BOOSEcode2.dll Custom array implementation that removes BOOSE size restrictions. Supports both integer and real (double) array types in 1D or 2D configurations. Works with peek and poke operations for array element access. public class MyArray : Evaluation, ICommand Inheritance object Command Evaluation MyArray Implements ICommand Derived MyPeek MyPoke Inherited Members Evaluation.expression Evaluation.evaluatedExpression Evaluation.varName Evaluation.value Evaluation.ProcessExpression(string) Evaluation.Expression Evaluation.VarName Evaluation.Value Evaluation.Local Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors MyArray() Initializes a new array instance. public MyArray() Fields PEEK Constant for peek operations. protected const bool PEEK = false Field Value bool POKE Constant for poke operations. protected const bool POKE = true Field Value bool column Evaluated column index. protected int column Field Value int columnS Column index expression string. protected string columnS Field Value string columns Number of columns in the array. protected int columns Field Value int intArray Integer array storage. protected int[,] intArray Field Value int[,] peekVar Variable name for peek result. protected string peekVar Field Value string pokeValue Value expression for poke. protected string pokeValue Field Value string realArray Real array storage. protected double[,] realArray Field Value double[,] row Evaluated row index. protected int row Field Value int rowS Row index expression string. protected string rowS Field Value string rows Number of rows in the array. protected int rows Field Value int type Array data type: int or real. public string type Field Value string valueInt Integer value for poke. protected int valueInt Field Value int valueReal Real value for poke. protected double valueReal Field Value double Properties Columns Gets the column count of the array. protected int Columns { get; } Property Value int Rows Gets the row count of the array. protected int Rows { get; } Property Value int Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Overrides validation to remove BOOSE array restrictions. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameterList) Parameters parameterList string[] Compile() Parses array declaration syntax. Format: array [type] [name] [rows] or array [type] [name] [rows,columns] public override void Compile() Exceptions CanvasException Thrown for invalid declaration syntax. Execute() Creates the array storage based on declared type. Allocates either integer or real array based on type specification. public override void Execute() Exceptions CanvasException Thrown for unsupported array types. GetIntArray(int, int) Retrieves integer value from array at specified position. public virtual int GetIntArray(int r, int c) Parameters r int Row index. c int Column index. Returns int Integer value at position. GetRealArray(int, int) Retrieves real value from array at specified position. public virtual double GetRealArray(int r, int c) Parameters r int Row index. c int Column index. Returns double Real value at position. ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool) Processes peek or poke syntax during compilation phase. Poke format: arrayName row [col] = value Peek format: variable = arrayName row [col] protected virtual void ProcessArrayParametersCompile(bool peekOrPoke) Parameters peekOrPoke bool True for poke, false for peek. ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool) Evaluates array indices and values during execution phase. protected virtual void ProcessArrayParametersExecute(bool peekOrPoke) Parameters peekOrPoke bool True for poke, false for peek. SetIntArray(int, int, int) Stores integer value in array at specified position. public virtual void SetIntArray(int val, int r, int c) Parameters val int Value to store. r int Row index. c int Column index. SetRealArray(double, int, int) Stores real value in array at specified position. public virtual void SetRealArray(double val, int r, int c) Parameters val double Value to store. r int Row index. c int Column index.

api/BOOSEcode2.MyBoolean.html.summary: Class MyBoolean Namespace BOOSEcode2 Assembly BOOSEcode2.dll Custom Boolean variable class that removes BOOSE restrictions. api/BOOSEcode2.MyCall.html.title: Class MyCall | BOOSE Documentation
api/BOOSEcode2.MyCall.html.summary: Class MyCall Namespace BOOSEcode2 Assembly BOOSEcode2.dll Custom call command for invoking defined methods. Removes BOOSE restrictions on method calls and argument passing. Syntax: call methodName [arg1, arg2, ...] public class MyCall : CompoundCommand, ICommand Inheritance object Command Evaluation Boolean ConditionalCommand CompoundCommand MyCall Implements ICommand Inherited Members CompoundCommand.ReduceRestrictions() CompoundCommand.CorrespondingCommand ConditionalCommand.endLineNumber ConditionalCommand.EndLineNumber ConditionalCommand.Condition ConditionalCommand.LineNumber ConditionalCommand.CondType ConditionalCommand.ReturnLineNumber Boolean.BoolValue Evaluation.expression Evaluation.evaluatedExpression Evaluation.varName Evaluation.value Evaluation.ProcessExpression(string) Evaluation.Expression Evaluation.VarName Evaluation.Value Evaluation.Local Command.IsDouble Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors MyCall() Initializes a new call command instance. public MyCall() Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Overrides validation to remove BOOSE restrictions. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameter) Parameters parameter string[] Compile() Parses call statement during compilation. Extracts method name and argument list. public override void Compile() Execute() Executes the method call. Evaluates arguments, creates local parameters, and transfers control to method. public override void Execute()

api/BOOSEcode2.MyCanvas.html.title: Class MyCanvas | BOOSE Documentation
api/BOOSEcode2.MyCanvas.html.summary: Class MyCanvas Namespace BOOSEcode2 Assembly BOOSEcode2.dll A simple canvas used by the BOOSE interpreter. Implements Singleton pattern to ensure only one canvas instance exists. Handles drawing shapes, lines, colours, text, and cursor movement. public class MyCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object MyCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties PenColour Not used by this custom canvas implementation. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Xpos Current X position of the drawing cursor. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Current Y position of the drawing cursor. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle centred at the current cursor position. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int Circle radius. filled bool Ignored. Circles are never filled. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if radius is zero or negative. Clear() Clears the canvas to a blank white screen. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a straight line from the current cursor to the given position, and then moves the cursor to that position. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int Destination X coordinate. y int Destination Y coordinate. GetInstance(int, int) Gets the singleton instance of MyCanvas. Creates the instance if it doesn't exist (thread-safe). public static MyCanvas GetInstance(int width = 900, int height = 600) Parameters width int Canvas width (only used on first call). height int Canvas height (only used on first call). Returns MyCanvas The singleton MyCanvas instance. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the drawing cursor without drawing anything. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int New X coordinate. y int New Y coordinate. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws an outline-only rectangle from the current cursor position. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool filled) Parameters width int Rectangle width. height int Rectangle height. filled bool Ignored. Rectangles are never filled. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if width or height are zero or negative. Reset() Resets the cursor position back to (0,0). public void Reset() ResetInstance() Resets the singleton instance. Used for testing purposes. Properly disposes of graphics resources before resetting. public static void ResetInstance() Set(int, int) Creates a new canvas of the given size and clears it. public void Set(int width, int height) Parameters width int New canvas width. height int New canvas height. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if width or height are zero or negative. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the pen colour using RGB values. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int Red (0-255) green int Green (0-255) blue int Blue (0-255) Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException Thrown if any value is out of range. Tri(int, int) Draws a right-angled triangle starting at the cursor. public void Tri(int width, int height) Parameters width int Width of the triangle. height int Height of the triangle. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if width or height are zero or negative. WriteText(string) Draws text at the current cursor position. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text to draw. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown if the text is null or empty. getBitmap() Returns the internal bitmap used by the canvas. public object getBitmap() Returns object The current canvas bitmap.

Should be called during program initialization. public static void SetCanvas(MyCanvas canvas) Parameters canvas MyCanvas

api/BOOSEcode2.html.title: Namespace BOOSEcode2 | BOOSE Documentation
api/BOOSEcode2.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEcode2 Classes BOOSEform Main Windows Form for running BOOSE programs. MyArray Custom array implementation that removes BOOSE size restrictions. Supports both integer and real (double) array types in 1D or 2D configurations. Works with peek and poke operations for array element access. MyBoolean Custom Boolean variable class that removes BOOSE restrictions. Handles boolean values and logical expressions. MyCall Custom call command for invoking defined methods. Removes BOOSE restrictions on method calls and argument passing. Syntax: call methodName [arg1, arg2, ...] MyCanvas A simple canvas used by the BOOSE interpreter. Implements Singleton pattern to ensure only one canvas instance exists. Handles drawing shapes, lines, colours, text, and cursor movement. MyCircle Replacement circle command that uses our canvas and does not have the BOOSE radius restriction. MyClear Custom clear command that clears the canvas. MyCommandFactory Custom command factory that creates custom BOOSE commands. Replaces specific BOOSE commands with custom implementations while allowing other standard BOOSE commands to work normally. MyElse Custom else command for if-else branching. Marks the transition from if-true block to if-false block. When the if condition is true, execution jumps over the else block. MyEnd Custom end command that closes if, while, for, and method blocks. Removes BOOSE nesting and complexity restrictions. Handles loop continuation and method returns. MyEvaluation Custom evaluation class for handling standalone variable assignments. Allows assignments like "width = 2*radius" after variable declaration. MyFor Custom for loop implementation that removes BOOSE iteration restrictions. Supports: for variable = start to end [step increment] Default step is 1 if not specified. MyIf Custom If command that removes nesting restrictions. Evaluates a boolean condition and executes commands conditionally. MyInt Custom integer variable implementation that removes BOOSE restrictions. Supports unlimited variable names and no count limits. Handles both declaration and initialization syntax. MyMethod Custom method command for defining reusable procedures. Removes BOOSE restrictions on method complexity and parameter count. Syntax: method returnType methodName [paramType paramName, ...] MyMoveTo Custom moveto command that simply forwards to our canvas. MyParser Custom parser that extends BOOSE's Parser to handle custom variable types. Intercepts int and real declarations to use custom classes, and handles standalone variable assignments. MyPeek Custom peek command for reading values from array elements. Inherits from MyArray to access array operations. Syntax: peek variable = arrayName row col (2D) or peek variable = arrayName row (1D) MyPoke Custom poke command for writing values into array elements. Inherits from MyArray to access array operations. Syntax: poke arrayName row col = value (2D) or poke arrayName row = value (1D) MyReal Custom real number variable implementation that removes BOOSE restrictions. Supports floating-point arithmetic and unlimited variable declarations. Handles variable substitution and expression evaluation. MyRect Custom rectangle command that draws a rectangle using the application's canvas instead of BOOSE's default one. MyTri Replacement triangle command that uses our canvas and does not have the BOOSE restrictions. MyWhile Custom While loop implementation that removes BOOSE restrictions. Executes a block of commands repeatedly while a condition remains true. Syntax: while [condition] ... endwhile MyWrite Custom write command for displaying text and variable values on the canvas. Supports variable substitution and expression evaluation for int, real, and boolean types.
